0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Cell-mediated immune reaction; Diagnosis: 0.1 mL INTRADERMALLY on the forearm

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Cell-mediated immune reaction; Diagnosis
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Papillomatosis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to eggs/egg products or inactive ingredients in the commercial product
  • hypersensitivity to thimerosal

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• administration should be done in a location with facilities to manage acute hypersensitivity reactions
  • vial contains dry natural latex rubber

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Skin reaction - finding, Local tenderness, pruritus
Serious
Immunologic:Allergic reaction, acute (Severe)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intradermal
  • shake well before withdrawing dose
  • inject on inner surface of forearm; evaluate injection site for reaction in 48 to 72 h

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: skin test reaction; 48 to 72 hours following administration

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: Instruct patient to return to healthcare professional 48 to 72 h after administration to have injection site assessed.
